content.description:
P1-The climb starts off at about 5.7 clipping a few bolts leading to the corner. After the first step where a bolt ladder (My Generation) breaks out right, stay in the corner the crux is about 2/3 up the  pitch where it steepens up.( I remember liebacking) and ends at a good ledge and anchor. 5.9+

P2- is quite a bit easier and stays in the corner for about 65 feet to the top of the wall. 5.6-ish

This route was probably done long ago. When TDA first walked up there he found a couple of soft iron pitons lying in the sand at the base. One which was fixed on the route to the right (My Generation) and held at least one whipper!
content.protection: A full rack to #4 camalot is nice. Slings helpful.
content.location:
The big east facing corner is Velvet Jones. A walk off to the north wrapping back east will get you down. There might be a top anchor for rapping.

Great warm up for choss climbing.

climbs.name: Never Again
climbs.fa: Ryan Meeks lead, Brad Kinross seconding 2009

content.description: Adventurous offwidth. Slightly loose. Still waiting for a second ascent.
content.protection: Big Gear. Sling anchor on big juniper tree.
content.location: About 30 yards to the right of "The Direct Route". Bring Webbing to replace the slung tree.Belay/Rappel off the second healthy looking tree shown in photo for a monster pitch. Super Exciting.

climbs.name: Kingpin
climbs.fa: Nate Brown, Calder Stratford, TDA??? 98 or 99

content.description: The Crux is between the first and second bolt. It is the most vertical part of the climb and involves smearing and manteling up to the slab.
content.protection:
3-4 bolts (2 angle aluminum hangers and a bent angle iron hanger)up to a 2 bolt chain, one hanger and weird wire sling thing anchor.  They are bomber though.

The drilled holes in the angle pieces are kind of small so bring skinny draws.

content.description:
(P1)The dihedral just to the right of King Pin.  Climb unprotected (5.3) for 35' until you reach the dihedral.  Follow dihedral for 50-60 feet to a bomber 3 bolt and chain anchor.(60 meter rope required, 70 meter would be better) This pitch is 5.8.

(P2) Traverse right up steeper rock with the crux near the top of the route.  Anchors for second pitch are far left.  They are the same anchors as the 2nd pitch of King Pin and need to be replaced.(60m rope required)

Descend via 2 single rope (60M) rappels down King Pin.
content.protection: Nuts to #3 Camalot.  Hexes are useful on this route too.
content.location:
10' right of King Pin.

Climb up to small ledge and then start up the gully until you reach the dihedral and can place the first piece.

content.description: The route starts in the center of the face and trends left.  Great route that seems to get a grade harder as you clip each bolt. Getting from the last bolt to the anchors may leave you perplexed.  A ring has been placed on the last bolt if you are forced to bail.  The taller you are the easier the crux will be.
content.location: Found on the face left of gutterball.
